Category - Health & Behavior










PA Program Breaks Top 100 in First US News Ranking Chapman University’s physician assistant program broke the top 100 in its first-ever ranking in U.S. News & World Report’s Best Health Schools. The program was ranked No. 96, putting Chapman in the top third of...


April 25, 2023 Joy Juedes

 









Chapman Boasts First Two-Time Simon Scholars Simon Family Foundation supports students facing adversity in high school through Chapman's physician assistant program. Miguel Lopez says his daughter “came home overjoyed” 12 years ago after finding out that the Simon Family Foundation would pay for her college education. “And today she came home even happier,” he says in Spanish in a...


April 10, 2023 Joy Juedes

 









CUSP Rakes in the Accolades Chapman University School of Pharmacy Professor Marc Fleming and Ph.D. candidate Mulan Homo brought home accolades from the American Pharmacists Association’s annual meeting.


March 29, 2023

 









Literary Therapy Crean College's Adult Learning Lab offers a book club for people with aphasia. A book club meets online to discuss their latest read, “Orphan Train.” They first launch into a lively discussion about the previous day’s Super Bowl. Eventually, one of the group’s student facilitators, Emmalee Nitti...


March 20, 2023 Joy Juedes

 






School of Communication Lecturer Earns Prestigious Fellowship Chapman School of Communication lecturer and Ph.D. candidate Amy Hellem (Ph.D. ’23) has completed a yearlong process of review to become a fellow of the American Academy of Optometry (AAO). “To be selected, Amy...


February 15, 2023 Dennis Arp

 









School of Pharmacy Honored for Collaborative Residency Program Chapman University’s School of Pharmacy (CUSP) and two of its partners were honored for their collaboration work at the Greater Irvine Chamber’s first Excellence in Healthcare awards gala. The Jan. 26 event recognizes...


January 31, 2023 Joy Juedes
